department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: a caryatid stool, the figure kneeling wtih heels turned upwards and raised hands supporting the seat on the finger tips, raised scarification on the torso and an elaborate coiffure of rising and falling cascades, seat and base with an identical recessed pattern, a dark brown; received on black metal base
marks: \"FC9110\", in white, on back of base
title: Chief's Stool
